questions.text: Which of the following statements is true?
questions.explanation: $4$ divides $16$ because $16 = 4 \cdot 4$. None of the other numbers divide the given integers.

questions.text: Which of the following means that $x$ divides $y$?
questions.explanation: By definition, $x$ divides $y$ if there exists an integer $k$ such that $y = xk$.

questions.text: Which of the following statements about odd and even numbers is true?
choices: The sum of two odd numbers is odd
The product of two odd numbers is even
The sum of an even and an odd number is odd
The product of an even and an odd number is odd
questions.explanation: An even number plus an odd number is always odd. The other statements are false.

questions.text: On a $12$-hour clock, what time is it $5$ hours after $9$ o'clock?
questions.explanation: Starting from $9$ and adding $5$ gives $14$, which corresponds to $2$ o'clock on a $12$-hour clock.

questions.text: Which of the following expresses the clock calculation $9 + 5 = 2$ correctly using modular arithmetic?
questions.explanation: On a $12$-hour clock, numbers are considered modulo $12$, so $9 + 5 \equiv 2 \pmod{12}$.

questions.text: Which of the following numbers is congruent to $17$ modulo $5$?
Which of the following statements is true?
If $x \equiv 1 \pmod{4}$, which of the following could be a value of $x$?
